document.discussion_title: Sprouts Farmers Market Inc (SFM) Position Raised by Rail Splitter Capital Management LLC – sleekmoney
document.topic_text: Tweet Rail Splitter Capital Management LLC raised its stake in Sprouts Farmers Market Inc (NYSE:SFM) by 30.6% during the fourth quarter, according to its most recent 13F filing with the SEC. The institutional investor owned 474,638 shares of the company’s stock after buying an additional 111,281 shares during the period. Sprouts Farmers Market comprises approximately 3.0% of Rail Splitter Capital Management LLC’s portfolio, making the stock its 11th largest position. Rail Splitter Capital Management LLC’s holdings in Sprouts Farmers Market were worth $12,621,000 as of its most recent SEC filing. A number of other hedge funds and other institutional investors have also bought and sold shares of the company. AGF Investments Inc. boosted its position in Sprouts Farmers Market by 22.9% in the fourth quarter. AGF Investments Inc. now owns 233,148 shares of the company’s stock valued at $6,202,000 after buying an additional 43,454 shares in the last quarter. TD Asset Management Inc. boosted its position in Sprouts Farmers Market by 6.3% in the fourth quarter. TD Asset Management Inc. now owns 170,000 shares of the company’s stock valued at $4,520,000 after buying an additional 10,000 shares in the last quarter. Trilogy Global Advisors LP boosted its position in Sprouts Farmers Market by 6.6% in the fourth quarter. Trilogy Global Advisors LP now owns 3,241,595 shares of the company’s stock valued at $86,193,000 after buying an additional 202,018 shares in the last quarter. Tributary Capital Management LLC boosted its position in Sprouts Farmers Market by 134.3% in the fourth quarter. Tributary Capital Management LLC now owns 95,600 shares of the company’s stock valued at $2,542,000 after buying an additional 54,800 shares in the last quarter. Finally, Eaton Vance Management boosted its position in Sprouts Farmers Market by 19.7% in the fourth quarter. Eaton Vance Management now owns 4,604,534 shares of the company’s stock valued at $122,435,000 after buying an additional 758,255 shares in the last quarter. Shares of Sprouts Farmers Market Inc ( NYSE:SFM ) traded up 1.62% during trading on Monday, reaching $28.20. The company’s stock had a trading volume of 744,805 shares. The company has a 50 day moving average of $28.47 and a 200 day moving average of $25.17. The company has a market cap of $4.24 billion and a PE ratio of 33.98. Sprouts Farmers Market Inc has a 12-month low of $16.41 and a 12-month high of $34.02. Sprouts Farmers Market (NYSE:SFM) last posted its earnings results on Thursday, February 25th. The company reported $0.18 earnings per share for the quarter, beating the Thomson Reuters’ consensus estimate of $0.16 by $0.02. The company earned $930.30 million during the quarter, compared to analyst estimates of $912.58 million. The firm’s revenue for the quarter was up 26.6% on a year-over-year basis. During the same quarter last year, the business posted $0.12 EPS. On average, analysts anticipate that Sprouts Farmers Market Inc will post $0.98 EPS for the current fiscal year. Several research analysts have weighed in on SFM shares. Zacks Investment Research reissued a “sell” rating on shares of Sprouts Farmers Market in a research report on Monday, January 18th. Barclays reissued an “overweight” rating and issued a $32.00 price objective on shares of Sprouts Farmers Market in a research report on Monday, April 4th. Wolfe Research raised Sprouts Farmers Market from a “market perform” rating to an “outperform” rating in a research report on Tuesday, April 12th. Stifel Nicolaus started coverage on Sprouts Farmers Market in a research report on Friday, February 12th. They issued a “buy” rating and a $27.00 price objective on the stock. Finally, Deutsche Bank reissued a “buy” rating and issued a $32.00 price objective on shares of Sprouts Farmers Market in a research report on Friday, February 26th. Nine investment analysts have rated the stock with a hold rating and thirteen have assigned a buy rating to the company’s stock. Sprouts Farmers Market currently has an average rating of “Buy” and a consensus target price of $29.20. In other Sprouts Farmers Market news, COO James Leroy Nielsen sold 1,057 shares of the business’s stock in a transaction on Monday, March 7th. The shares were sold at an average price of $27.93, for a total value of $29,522.01. Following the completion of the transaction, the chief operating officer now owns 14,476 shares in the company, valued at $404,314.68. The transaction was disclosed in a legal filing with the SEC, which is accessible through this hyperlink . Also, Director James Douglas Sanders sold 14,532 shares of the business’s stock in a transaction on Friday, March 18th. The stock was sold at an average price of $30.00, for a total transaction of $435,960.00. Following the completion of the transaction, the director now owns 69,842 shares of the company’s stock, valued at approximately $2,095,260. The disclosure for this sale can be found here . Sprouts Farmers Market, Inc is a food retailer. The Company operates as a grocery store that offers natural and organic food, including produce, bulk foods, vitamins and supplements, grocery, meat and seafood, bakery, dairy, frozen foods, body care and natural household items. As of February 26, 2015, the Company operated 198 stores in 12 states. Want to see what other hedge funds are holding SFM?
